title: About
text:
The home page shows the relationship between the Temperature (°F) and Ozone (ppb) in New York, United States of America (USA).





New York, USA (Pinterest)

title: About
text:
Details
Temperature (degree Fahrenheit) refers to the highest temperature taken at La Guardia Airport, New York.
Ozone (ppb) refers to the average ozone measured between 1 PM to 3 PM at Roosevelt Island, New York.
Both Temperature (degree Fahrenheit) and Ozone (ppb) serves as an estimate of the temperature and ozone in New York.

title: About
text:
“airquality” Dataset
It is a dataset that is embedded in R. It measures different environmental characteristics in New York, USA from May to September in 1973.
Some of the variables in the airquality dataset include:


[1] "Ozone"   "Solar.R" "Wind"    "Temp"    "Month"   "Day"

title: About
text:
Details of Variables Used
Temperature (°F) refers to the highest temperature taken at La Guardia Airport, New York.
Ozone (ppb) refers to the average ozone measured between 1 PM to 3 PM at Roosevelt Island, New York.
Both Temperature (°F) and Ozone (ppb) serves as an estimate of the temperature and ozone in New York.

title: About
text:
Background of “airquality” Dataset
It is a dataset that is embedded in R. It measures different environmental characteristics in New York, USA from May to September in 1973.
Some of the variables in the airquality dataset include:


[1] "Ozone"   "Solar.R" "Wind"    "Temp"    "Month"   "Day"    


The number of data collected in the airquality dataset:


[1] 153

title: Air Quality
section: This shows the rows which have “NA” values in the Ozone variable.
text:
This shows the rows which have “NA” values in the Ozone variable.


 [1]   5  10  25  26  27  32  33  34  35  36  37  39  42  43  45  46  52  53  54
[20]  55  56  57  58  59  60  61  65  72  75  83  84 102 103 107 115 119 150



filtered_dataset <- airquality %>%
  filter(Ozone >= 0, Temp >= 0) %>%
  select(Ozone, Temp) %>%
  arrange(Ozone)

title: Air Quality
section: This shows the first and last 5 rows of the filtered dataset (which involves the removal of “NA” values in Ozone (ppb).

airquality %>%
  summarise(mean = mean(Temp),
            min = mean(Temp),
            max = max(Temp))

      mean      min max
1 77.88235 77.88235  97
